qas.question: What was built around Hakata Bay?
When did Japan begin building the Hakata Bay barrier?
When did Japan finish building the Hakata Bay barrier?
How long was the Hakata Bay barrier?
What happened to diplomatic envoys the Mongols sent to Japan?

context: The Japanese defenders recognized the possibility of a renewed invasion, and began construction of <a0_0>a great stone barrier<a0_0/> around Hakata Bay in <a1_0>1276<a1_0/>. Completed in <a2_0>1277<a2_0/>, this wall stretched for <a3_0>20 kilometers<a3_0/> around the border of the bay. This would later serve as a strong defensive point against the Mongols. The Mongols attempted to settle matters in a diplomatic way from 1275 to 1279, but every envoy sent to Japan was <a4_0>executed<a4_0/>. This set the stage for one of the most famous engagements in Japanese history.
